step1.sentence: There has been a sharp increase in demand for online learning tools since last year.

step2.story: The sharp increase in energy prices had forced the organization to rethink decisions it had assumed were settled. What had seemed like a stable operating environment had changed in a matter of months, and the planning assumptions that had guided the last three years were no longer valid.

step3.story: The public health team was tracking a sharp increase in respiratory cases in three districts simultaneously. The data alone did not explain the cause — seasonal patterns, new pathogen, or environmental factor were all possible. They dispatched field teams to gather qualitative data alongside the epidemiological data. The field teams found, within forty-eight hours, that all three districts shared a water source that had recently had a maintenance disruption. The sharp increase had an environmental cause that the surveillance data alone would not have identified for another three weeks.

meaning.shortExampleEn: The report noted a sharp increase in customer complaints last quarter.
